intro: Mesembryanthemum subhispidum, commonly known as the sand mat or desert star, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom in the early morning. Mesembryanthemum subhispidum is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
